content: Did Benito Mussolini make the trains run on time in Italy?

Yes, Benito Mussolini is often credited with improving the Italian railway system during his rule in the 1920s and 1930s. Under his fascist regime, there were significant investments in infrastructure, including the railways, which led to increased efficiency and punctuality. This improvement was part of Mussolini's broader efforts to modernize Italy and project an image of strength and efficiency.
